The base class for all vehicles.

ngl::Vec3 Vehicle::findNearestExit ( std::vector< ngl::Vec3 >  _exits  ) 

Finds the nearest vec3 from a vector of Vec3s.

Parameters:
[in] _exits,: vector of Vec3s to search through
Returns:
Vec3: the vector of the nearest exit

Find Exit - given a vector of vectors, this function iterates through and finds the closest point to the vehicle

  • mainly used for rioters finding their way home
  • using the returned vector, a path can be found to that point

Definition at line 157 of file Vehicle.cpp.

References BaseGameEntity::getPos().

00158 {
00159   //find nearest point to current positiong and set that as path thing
00160 
00161   ngl::Vec3 bestExit;
00162   float dist = 1000000000.0;
00163   int exitSize = _exits.size();
00164   for(int i = 0; i<exitSize; i++)
00165   {
00166     ngl::Vec3 currentExit = _exits[i];
00167     float testDist = (currentExit- this->getPos()).lengthSquared();
00168     if(testDist < dist*dist)
00169     {
00170       bestExit = currentExit;
00171       dist = testDist;
00172     }
00173   }
00174   return bestExit;
00175 }

void Vehicle::findPath ( ngl::Vec3  _target  ) 

Method to find a path to the target.

Find Path - sets m_path to be a path to the inputted target, if this path is not zero then the vehicle is set to follow.

Parameters:
[in] _target,: sets the target point to find a path to

void Vehicle::followPath (  ) 

Method to go through path and set the crosshair as the next point when current crosshair has been reached.

Follow Path - function iterates through the vectors in the path, and once the vehicle has reached the current crosshair, the next one is set as the destination

Definition at line 194 of file Vehicle.cpp.

References BaseGameEntity::getPos(), m_crosshair, m_path, m_pathIndex, and setPathIndex().

ngl::Vec3 Vehicle::smoothingUpdate ( ngl::Vec3  _recentHeading  ) 

Method to smooth the heading of the vehicle.

Smoothing - calculates the average heading from a set number of past headings (_sampleSize).

Parameters:
[in] _recentHeading,: the current heading to pass in
Returns:
Vec3: returns the average heading from a set number of previous headings

Here is the caller graph for this function:

void Vehicle::update ( double  time_elapsed  ) 

Method to update the vehicle every tick.

Parameters:
[in] time_elapsed,: the time elapsed between each tick

Update Function - used to calculate the acceleration, using the steering force and mass, this is multiplied by the time elapsed from the last tick to create the new vehicle position

  • Smoothing is also added to the heading, so that the jumpy erratic movement is removed
  • finally if a path has been set the vehicle is set to follow it

Definition at line 61 of file Vehicle.cpp.

References SteeringBehaviour::calculatePrioritizedSum(), followPath(), MovingEntity::getHeading(), MovingEntity::m_heading, MovingEntity::m_mass, MovingEntity::m_maxSpeed, m_path, BaseGameEntity::m_pos, MovingEntity::m_side, m_smoothHeading, m_smoothingOn, m_steering, m_timeElapsed, MovingEntity::m_velocity, and smoothingUpdate().

00066   SteeringForce = m_steering->calculatePrioritizedSum();
